name: WALLPAPER
description:
US-based computer engineer and innovator PJ Sanders returns to his remote family home in rural England following the death of his elderly mother. His agenda: to close the place down and sell it. 

But not before he tries out an experimental Augmented Reality device he’s been working on, primed to help him uncover the history behind one particularly strange room in the house – a room that has remained locked since his childhood.

Part of a research project called Reading Digital Fiction led by Professor Alice Bell from Sheffield Hallam University, Wallpaper was designed, written and coded by digital artists Andy Campbell and Judi Alston. It's their first ever narrative game.

WALLPAPER featured at Bank Street Arts in Sheffield, UK in 2015 and in the Being Human Festival of the Humanities in 2016 alongside a VR prototype version. It was also exhibited in Porto, Portugal as part of the Electronic Literature Organisation‘s Annual Conference in 2017 and showcased at Wakefield Literature Festival

The music was created by Barry Snaith

You can view the WALLPAPER Blog here to follow the work’s progress since its initial release for installation in 2015.

“Tremendous experience – loved the atmosphere.” – Ian Deon

“Held my breath through most of it… Beautiful and immersive.” – Jessica Nonedge

“Beautiful. Very detailed, loved the sound, the mystery.” – Stephen Elliot

“Visually stunning with an evocative soundtrack.” – Chris Joseph

Recommended spec requirements: 64-bit PC desktop or laptop running a modern graphics card; 8GB RAM and speakers or headphones.
